title: Cedar Breaks National Monument: Park Home
body: Geology, Wildflowers and Night Skies at 10,000 Feet  Discover one of America's most special parks! Crowning the grand staircase, Cedar Breaks sits at over 10,000 feet and looks down into a half-mile deep geologic amphitheater. Come wander among timeless bristlecone pines, stand in lush meadows of wildflower, ponder crystal-clear night skies and experience the richness of our subalpine forest.              Plan Your Visit   Discover this lesser known park and enjoy our sub-alpine environment! Lush meadows and colorful hoodoos await your exploration.             Life at the Park   Learn more about park history and the plants and animals that call Cedar Breaks home!         Coming Up at Cedar Breaks   This is the place to search for seasonal activities & events that occur at or near Cedar Breaks throughout the year.               Every Kid in a Park Pass   The Every Kid in a Park pass is good for the full academic year of fourth-grade students.        Social Media & Apps    Have fun learning about the park, sharing photos, memories and experiences. Get up-to-date information sent right to your mobile device!         Become a Junior Ranger   Hey kids! Don't just be a tourist at Cedar Breaks, become a junior ranger! All you need is a sense of curiosity and a bit of time.
